Review Text: Anara Airport Hotel is an excellent choice if you need a place directly at Jakarta Airport ‚Äî you can reach it easily on foot, which is incredibly convenient after a long flight. The hotel is modern, clean, and very well organized. If you‚Äôre planning to explore the city, you should stay somewhere more central, as this location is purely ideal for airport convenience. But as an airport hotel, it‚Äôs absolutely perfect. The breakfast buffet is very extensive, with a wide selection of dishes ‚Äî everyone will find something they like. I highly recommend it for a comfortable and stress-free stay near the airport.

This hotel would be excellent but for a few important issues: 1) the Android room TV was the most unnecessarily complicated and user-UNfriendly of any that I have ever attempted to use. We had the technician come to our room and even he struggled to get it to work. BTW, there are controls behind the TV surround/bezel, which hinges to the left. We had to open that to disconnect and kill the image when we wanted to sleep! Who designs these systems?! 2) then we decided to kill all the power to the room with the room-key switch but the emergency torch/flashlight did NOT work. I wonder what other hotel safety facilities are non-functional; management take note! 3) the room fridge was empty - a waste of space. There was nithing inside, not even water!? 4) the shower cubicle door opened inwards - a safey issue - but that did NOT stop water from covering the bathroom floor. However the staff were all very friendly and the breakfast buffet excellent, especially the bubur ayam (chicken rice congee). The location for the airport terminal 3 could not be better: an indoor direct walk to your gate, all air-conditioned.

This was a great hotel to spend a layover in - extremely good value for money with very spacious, clean rooms. However, it is very difficult to find if you are unfamiliar with the airport. As all instructions online are vague, so here is how to get to the hotel when arriving into Terminal 3. After leaving the customs/immigration area and entering the arrivals hall you are looking for the escalators up to the departures level on your right. If you get to the exit doors to go outside you have gone too far, turn back and look for the escalators up to the check-in/departures hall. When you are on the upper level, continue straight following signs for the carpark/airport hotel. This will take you through an indoor walkway into a building with airline offices that is attached to the carpark. Anara Airport Hotel is inside this building on its right hand side - it is reasonably well signposted once you are inside this building but it can be confusing getting there in the first place. In summary - up the escalators, then straight ahead, then it's on your right once you are no longer inside the terminal and have crossed into the office building.
